page.title: 11Religion in Llanelli.
page.content: The Parish Church. The present Parish Church is nearly 100 years old,but its tower dates from 1200. All services were in Welsh until recently when a bilingual Communion Service was introduced so that more parishioners could use the Mother Church The Roman Catholic Church is expected to be demolished this year because of its dangerous condition,and a new one built,if money is available. Both the Church in Wales and the Roman Catholic Church have Voluntary Aided Primary Schools in the block. Attendance at many Welsh Chapels is very low,but Chapels where the services are in English are usually better attended.
